intro: Wendlandia glabrata var. glabrata, commonly known as the silverleaf waterwheel, is a striking plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its unique foliage and vibrant floral display.
